column10: Abamune 300 mg Tablet is used in the treatment of HIV infection.
column11: Side Effects of Abamune are Fatigue, Headache, Nausea, Vomiting, Ear infection, Nasal infection, Throat infection, Skin rash, Fever, Chills, Abnormal dreams, Dizziness.
column12: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Abamune 300 mg Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time.
column13: Abamune 300 mg Tablet is an antiviral medication. It prevents the multiplication of virus in human cells. This stops the virus from producing new viruses and clears up your infection.
column14: [('/drugs/a-bec-300mg-tablet-230792', 'A-Bec 300mg Tablet', 'Emcure Pharmaceuticals Ltd'), ('/drugs/virol-300mg-tablet-231559', 'Virol 300mg Tablet', 'Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd'), ('/drugs/abhope-300mg-tablet-231401', 'ABHOPE 300MG TABLET', 'Abbott')]
column15: [('Alcohol', 'Taking Abacavir with alcohol may cause minor drug interactions which may not be clinically relevant in all patients.'), ('Pregnancy', 'Abamune 300 mg Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy.Animal studies have shown adverse effects on the foetus, however, there are limited human studies. The benefits from use in pregnant women may be acceptable despite the risk. Please consult your doctor.'), ('Lactation', 'Abamune 300 mg Tablet is probably safe to use during lactation. \nLimited human data suggests that the drug does not represent a significant risk to the baby.'), ('Driving', 'Abamune 300 mg Tablet does not usually affect your ability to drive.'), ('Kidney', 'Abamune 300 mg Tablet is safe to use in patients with kidney disease. No dose adjustment of Abamune 300 mg Tablet is recommended.Talk to your doctor in case you have serious kidney disease.'), ('Liver', 'Abamune 300 mg Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Abamune 300 mg Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.Use of Abamune 300 mg Tablet is not recommended in patients with moderate and severe liver disease.')]

column1: A Bec L 600 mg/300 mg Tablet
column10: A Bec L 600 mg/300 mg Tablet is used in the treatment of HIV infection.
column11: Side Effects of A Bec L are Nausea, Vomiting, Diarrhoea, Dizziness, Headache, Tiredness, Insomnia (difficulty in sleeping), Allergic reaction, Depression.
column12: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. A Bec L 600 mg/300 mg Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time.
column13: A Bec L 600 mg/300 mg Tablet is a combination of two anti-HIV medicines: Abacavir and Lamivudine. They prevent HIV (virus) from multiplying, thereby reducing the amount of virus in your body. They also increase the CD4 cell (white blood cells that protect against infection) count in your blood.

column10: Orencia 250 mg Injection is used in the treatment of ankylosing spondylitis, rheumatoid arthritis, psoriasis, ulcerative colitis and Crohn’s disease.
column11: Side Effects of Orencia are Nausea, Headache, Upper respiratory tract infection, Nasopharyngitis (inflammation of the throat and nasal passages).
column12: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer.
column13: Orencia 250 mg Injection blocks the action of certain chemical messengers that are responsible for inflammation, swelling and redness associated with certain joint diseases.
column15: [('Alcohol', 'Interaction with alcohol is unknown. Please consult your doctor.'), ('Liver', 'There is limited information available on the use of Orencia 250 mg Injection in patients with liver disease. Please consult your doctor.')]

column10: Abcixirel 10 mg Injection is used in the treatment of unstable angina. It is also used in patients undergoing surgery to treat blockages in their blood vessels (angioplasty).
column11: Side Effects of Abcixirel are Bleeding, Low blood platelets.
column12: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer.
column13: Abcixirel 10 mg Injection is an antiplatelet medication. It works by preventing platelets from sticking together which decreases the formation of harmful blood clots.

column10: Acamprol 333 mg Tablet is used in alcohol dependence.
column11: Side Effects of Acamprol are Diarrhoea, Abdominal pain, Nausea, Vomiting, Decreased libido, Itching, Flatulence, Impotence.
column12: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Acamprol 333 mg Tablet is to be taken with food.
column13: Acamprol 333 mg Tablet blocks the chemical which breaks the converted form of alcohol in the body. This leads to an increased level of converted form of alcohol in the body causing bad physical features while drinking alcohol.
column15: [('Alcohol', 'Interaction with alcohol is unknown.
